title: How to Roll Trick Marijuana Joints

steps.title: Make a roach about the size of a pencil.
steps.content: Make a roach about the size of a pencil. Cut the glue strips from some papers to seal it.

steps.title: Make a cone by gluing two papers together to make a square or rectangle.
steps.content: Make a cone by gluing two papers together to make a square or rectangle. Fold one corner of the square diagonally to the opposite corner, just before the glue strip starts. Fold down the glue strip and seal it to make a flat cone. Cut any excess if you want to.

steps.title: Fill your cone.
steps.content: Fill your cone. Open up the cone and fill it with your preferred mix.

steps.title: Pinch the sides of the opening closed and gather the edges together, like wrapping a bottle of booze.
steps.content: Pinch the sides of the opening closed and gather the edges together, like wrapping a bottle of booze.

steps.title: Place the roach into the opening and then tie them together, either with a rubber band, the glue strip from a paper, or some dental floss.
steps.content: Place the roach into the opening and then tie them together, either with a rubber band, the glue strip from a paper, or some dental floss.

steps.title: Glue two papers together, short end to short end, so that the glue strips form a single, straight line.
steps.content: Glue two papers together, short end to short end, so that the glue strips form a single, straight line.

steps.title: Glue a third paper at the center, covering the overlapping line.
steps.content: Glue a third paper at the center, covering the overlapping line. This third paper will help make it stronger. Or, for less paper in your joint, simply fold the third rolling paper in half so that you have a glue strip on the outside of each side of it, lick it, and place it vertically between the overlapping part of the two papers, using the glue to stick them together and strengthen the joint.

steps.title: Roll the rest of the joint as you normally would, either straight or in a cone.
steps.content: Roll the rest of the joint as you normally would, either straight or in a cone.

steps.title: Make a cone, just like is described above for the Tulip Joint.
steps.content: Make a cone, just like is described above for the Tulip Joint. Don’t pinch the opening closed, though. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make a cone shaped joint by wrapping the paper around the roach tighter and at an angle.
steps.content: Make a cone shaped joint by wrapping the paper around the roach tighter and at an angle. Don’t make it too angled, though. You might need to practice. The width of the opening at the end of the cone joint should be the same as the cone you made earlier.

steps.title: Glue the cone ends together and seal them with the glue strips cut from other papers.
steps.content: Glue the cone ends together and seal them with the glue strips cut from other papers.
